A Kirin Tor mage has arrived in your court

During my time as the Guardian of Tirisfal I have come to realise that the amount of good I can do is largely limited by the tools at my disposal. As I ponder this I suddenly remember the stories of Ebonchill, the legendary staff of Alodai, the first guardian. The staff has been locked away by the Kirin Tor for a long time waiting for a mage powerful enough to responsibly wield it. Perhaps I am that mage?
Yes, I will claim the staff. For the Kirin Tor!
No, I am not yet ready to wield such power.

As the other archmages help me disable the wards protecting the staff I finally lay my eyes on it. The staff with its ornatly carved handle with what looks like an ice crystal suspended above it almost seems to be radiating power. As I step foward and grab the staff I feel stronger and i know that I made the right choice.
Finally I have the tools necessary to save this world.

This greatstaff was wielded by Alodi, the first Guardian of Tirisfal. He bore the staff into many battles against Legion forces for the century in which he served as Guardian, then stepped down from the role of Guardian, but he retained the staff to his dying day. Upon his passing, the Kirin Tor stored the staff safely away for fear of what might happen if a lesser mage attempted to wield its power without the ability to control it fully

The Guardian of Tirisfal is a mortal given power by the most senior members of the Kirin Tor to fight the evils of this world. With the resent death of [Root.GetFirstName] however Azeroth once again stands without a guardian.
What will this mean for the future of our world?

The Guardian of Tirisfal is a mortal given power by the most senior members of the Kirin Tor to fight the evils of this world. It has been long since Azeroth had had a guardian fighting for its interests. Perhaps with all that is going on in the world it is time someone once again took up the mantle of guardian?
I will take on the role of Azeroths protector!

After gathering the other Archmages of the Kirin Tor they agree to lend me some of their power so that I can become the next guardian. As the ritual concludes I feel my newfound strength and the weight of the responsibility that comes with it.
I will do my best to help save this world.
The reforemd council of Tirisfal has decided to once again name a guadian, a mortal given power by the most senior members of the Kirin Tor to fight the evils of this world.
Azeroth once again has a champion in the fight against evil.
Reform the council of Tirisfal and become the next guardian.
The death of the last guardian has been felt. Perhaps it is time that I step into their shoes and take up the mantle of guardian?
I will do my best to live up to the title of guardian.
I am not ready for the responsibility.

I will try it out on myself, what ccould go wrong?
